attires.name: Ghoongat
attires.description: A traditional veil or scarf draped over the head and often the face, worn by women in North India as a symbol of modesty and respect.

attires.name: Monkey Cap
attires.description: A knitted woolen cap covering the head and neck, commonly worn by men and children during winter in North India, especially Delhi.

attires.name: Pagri (Turban)
attires.description: A traditional turban, worn in various styles across India, symbolizing honor, respect, and cultural identity.

attires.name: Safa
attires.description: A style of turban, usually brightly colored and worn during weddings and festivals in Rajasthan and Gujarat.

attires.name: Pheta
attires.description: A distinctive style of turban from Maharashtra, often worn during ceremonies and celebrations.

attires.name: Patka
attires.description: A simple headscarf or small turban, commonly worn by Sikh boys and men, especially in Punjab.

attires.name: South Indian Temple Jewelry
attires.description: Ornate gold jewelry with temple motifs, worn on the head and hair by classical dancers and brides in South India.

attires.name: Punjabi Paranda
attires.description: A colorful, decorative tassel braided into the hair by Punjabi women, especially during festivals and celebrations.
